etymologies: mid 19th century: from French artésien ‘from Artois’ (see Artois), where such wells were first made

definitions: relating to or denoting a well bored perpendicularly into water-bearing strata lying at an angle, so that natural pressure produces a constant supply of water with little or no pumping

examples.text: the water from artesian wells makes agriculture possible

shortDefinitions: of well bored perpendicularly into water-bearing strata lying at angle
